Description: Sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; a letter.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: R.J. Demarée The Bankes Late Ramesside Papyri (British Museum Research Publication 155; London: British Museum Press 2005), 7-9, 34-37.

Published by I E S Edwards in JEA 68, 1982, 127-132, as 'Papyrus Bankes I'. William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139351) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139351)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
